p.n: Cecil B. DeMille: The Directors I (7)
p.k: A look at the films of Cecil B DeMille, the director who became a giant of the 20th-century film industry, known for epics such as The Ten Commandments
Works by Winston Churchill and LS Lowry go under the hammer in a modern British art sale in London. Petrol-heads gather in Goodwood for a prestigious
A desk made by famous furniture-maker John Townsend goes under the hammer in New York. Plus, two illuminated manuscripts from the Middle Ages go up for auction in London

p.n: LSO: Sir John Eliot Gardiner Conducts Mendelssohn
p.k: Sir John Eliot Gardiner conducts the London Symphony Orchestra and the Monteverdi Choir in this celebration of Felix Mendelssohn's work
A look at the life of Oscar and Emmy-winning film and dance legend Bob Fosse, with insights from the people he inspired throughout his career
In The Bag Cara hires safecracker Sam to get back her confiscated jewels. But when she insists on joining him on the job, Sam could be making the biggest
A Man With A Fortune A rich and lonely American ventures to England in search of his long-lost family. But when he meets Jane and her flatmate Eva, things begin to go wrong

p.n: The Adventurers Of Modern Art I (6)
p.k: Midnight in Paris Paris reawakens from World War II to find that an astonishing work has been created from within its war-torn midst - the film Les Enfants du Paradis
A look at the life of legendary two-time Academy Award winner Robert De Niro, star of The Godfather Part II, Taxi Driver and Goodfellas
Alain Delon A glimpse into the life of French star and winner of the 2019 Honorary Palme d'Or, Alain Delon
Who's Got The Lady? When a piece of art is stolen, the gallery owner gets his girlfriend to make copies of it to sell. But did the work ever really leave the building?
The Skeleton Key A woman discovers a nasty side to her husband's personality when he goes into hospital before a holiday
Narrated by Noddy Holder, the eye-opening series examining the key moments that have shaped musical history turns its attention to Two Tone

p.n: Landscape Artist Of The Year 2016 II (1)
p.k: Frank Skinner and Joan Bakewell search for a new star landscape artist as contestants capture National Trust properties across the country, starting
New. Pets and Friends This week the photographers head to Rome where they are challenged to capture the special bond between pets and their owners
A look at the life of Academy Award-winning Maggie Smith. From Harry Potter to Downton Abbey, her huge portfolio makes her one of the UK's most recognisable actresses
A look at the Academy Award-winning actor, best known for his starring role in Gandhi. He has also appeared in films such as Shutter Island and Iron Man 3

p.k: Midnight in Paris Paris reawakens from World War II to find that an astonishing work has been created from within its war-torn midst - the film Les Enfants du Paradis

p.n: Marcel Duchamp: The Art Of The Possible
p.k: New. Film exploring one of the 20th century's most influential modernists and how his revolutionary ideas and philosophies changed the way
Ripped From the Headlines An engaging and entertaining look at the origins of topical humour, from the rise of the monologue to the 'fake news' shows of today
Barry Cryer reflects on the life and career of British-born American entertainer Bob Hope, whose remarkable comedy and acting career spanned nearly 80 years
